oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The association between β-hydroxybutyrate concentration at diagnosis of left displaced abomasum in dairy cows and removal from the herd postsurgical correction
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Croushore, William
Opsina, Paula
Welch, David
Zawisza, Daniel
Nydam, Daryl
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: left displaced abomasum
LDA
β-hydroxybutyrate
BHB
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Left displaced abomasum (LDA) is an economically important disease of dairy cattle. This study investigated the sensitivity and specificity of various β-hydroxybutyrate (BHB) concentrations measured at the time of LDA surgery, and its association with removal from the herd within 30 days after LDA surgery.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2012; 189
